job_description: National Salvage, an industry leader, seeks a Project Analyst to deliver BI data, reports and reporting solutions. This position is based at our corporate headquarters in Bloomington, Ind. This is NOT a remote position. The ideal candidate understands the advantage of working IT for a small company, including having a personal stake in the design and outcome of projects and, ultimately, company success. The focus is on high-quality, detailed work based on established standards, while thriving with repetitive routines in a steady environment. The position requires a strong ability to place the appropriate data to business users. It provides the chance to work on company initiatives and exciting IT projects.DUTIES, TASKS, AND RESPONSIBILITIESCreate, manage and support databases, data models, BI reports.Define specifications for a data warehousing infrastructure in support of the company’s BI needsWork directly with stakeholders to generate actionable reporting on production, sales and inventory.Collaborate with IT to develop and deploy business solutions using Office 365.Generate ad hoc reports as requested from multiple department heads.Position-specific CompetenciesExperience with Power BI & MS SQL ServerExperience using Python in a business environment strongly preferredAbility to create and present actionable business reportingAdvanced Excel skillsExperience with Power Apps & Power Automate a plusEffective written and oral communication abilities.Qualifications3-plus years of experience with data-and/or reporting-related responsibilities is required.Benefits of NationalCompetitive payFull health benefits including health, dental, vision, and long term disability401(K) plan with company matchFlexible dates for time offThis job description is not intended to be comprehensive list of the duties and responsibilities of the position. Duties and responsibilities may change without notice.This is an exempt position.

Diversity of backgrounds, ideas, thoughts, and experiences is vital to our culture and the way we do business. Creating an environment where differences are embraced and where every person feels engaged and included makes us safer, stronger, and more successful.With a history dating back to 1886, American Water is the largest and most geographically diverse U.S. publicly traded water and wastewater utility company. The company employs more than 7,000 dedicated professionals who provide regulated and market-based drinking water, wastewater and other related services to 15 million people in 46 states. American Water provides safe, clean, affordable and reliable water services to our customers to help make sure we keep their lives flowing. For more information, visit amwater.com and follow American Water on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn.Primary RoleThe Sr. Data Visualization Analyst (Sr. DVA) role serves as liaison between business SMEs, project teams, Technical teams, senior and other stakeholders with focus on data visualization and storytelling, and relevant solution delivery. The Sr. DVA is responsible for evaluating, understanding, translating and presenting information in ways that are universally understandable or easy to interpret, and spot patterns, trends and correlations. These representations include charts, graphs, dashboard, infographics and other pictorial diagrams. The Sr. DVA will understand and use data science as well as technology tools to communicate and deliver information expressed as visual, predictive, and/or prescriptive analytics based on HR’s operational & business needs.The Sr. DVA performs a variety of duties related to data including conducting full life cycle analysis from requirements gathering to data collection and creating reports/data visualizations. This position provides independent, capable professional performance of assigned tasks and escalates when necessary. The Sr. DVA stays current on emerging IT and data trends, identifies opportunities for improvement and cost savings and works with Digital HR team & business partners to determine new ways to use data. The Sr. DVA responsible for mentoring and coaching of Digital HR team members to elevate and strengthen the team’s data analytics understanding and skills. This also includes business partner if/when appropriate.Key AccountabilitiesMaking large and/or complex data more accessible, understandable and usableTransforming, improving and integrating data, Position Summary:Under general supervision, the Master Data Analyst will have the primary responsibility for ensuring that master data is maintained by entering, updating, and maintaining master data, as well as having a full understanding of the impact of this data across the value chain. This role will also support inter-company customer orders, ensuring that orders are accurate and scheduled accordingly. This position will be focused on ensuring customer satisfaction (measured by OTIF – on time in full), communicating with other sites regarding product schedules, as well as maximizing freight efficiency by building full truckloads.Essential Functions & Key Responsibilities:Responsible for ensuring that master data is properly defined and setup in our ERP systems. Working closely with the Master Data Manager, the Master Data Analyst is also responsible for data collection, entry and loading of local Master Data into IFS, including Bill of Materials, Customer and Material records, etc.Understand the data elements and how they flow through the supply chain.Prioritize workload to balance multiple customer requests and deliver responses within agreed upon timeframe.Collaborate with Operations, Warehouse, and others as needed to ensure orders are successfully processed and fulfilled.Answer customer enquiries regarding product information, order status, shipment tracking, etc.Run Open Order report daily to ensure all orders are properly confirmed and released to shipping as needed.Receive and process requests from the user community for changes to, or creation of master data records, and manage the requests through a formal process of validation and approval.Coordinate with the user community to ensure correctness and completeness of data contained in requests.Responsible for prompt implementation of all Master Data procedures to ensure that all information systems and services meet the company standards and end-user requirements.Troubleshoot and resolve master data issues.Candidate Requirements:Degree in Data Analytics, Business, Supply Chain, Logistics or 2-4 years' equivalent work experience.Solid experience in Microsoft Office products, specifically Excel, (ability to perform Vlookups and formatting. Pivot-Tables a plus!)ERP experience strongly preferred.Must be a team player.Excellent analytical, interpersonal and organizational skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills are critical.Detail oriented / Ability to maintain high data integrity during data transfer process.Ability to quickly and effectively prioritize a large volume of tasks to ensure timelines are met, and all information is available to the user community quickly and effectively.Successful candidates must have a passion for on-time customer service, proactive problem-solving, superior attention to detail.Customer-focused mindset, experience in fast-paced manufacturing environment preferred.Please no recruiting agenciesFollowing GMP in compliance with all food safety requirements.Novolex does not publicly post salary information on job boards.Novolex™ is committed to providing equal employment opportunity in all employment practices, including but not limited to, selection, hiring, promotion, transfer, and compensation to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to age, race, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, handicap or disability, genetics, citizenship status, service member or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law. Any individual, who because of his or her disability, needs an accommodation in connection with an aspect of the Company’s application process should contact Jamie Wells at hrcompliance@novolex.com.#LI-JH1 #MON1

COMPANY SNAPSHOTFounded in 1958, Buckeye Corrugated, Inc. (BCI) is an industry-leading designer and manufacturer of corrugated packaging and displays. Privately held and employee-owned, BCI's services and capabilities include custom-designed corrugated packaging, point-of-purchase displays, point-of-sale packaging, along with fulfillment and logistics.At BCI, employees think like customers and act like owners. People are the key piece of the puzzle, and BCI's investment in hiring and developing the best talent fosters innovation and efficiency that drives business growth. The President and CEO of BCI says it best, "If you want to make a difference, then we are the company for you."POSITION SUMMARYBCI is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join their growing Information Technology team. This newly created position will be responsible for developing and enhancing the organization's use of data analytics. The Senior Data Analyst will work closely with functional leaders to obtain knowledge of business operations and build reports, dashboards, metrics, and other data-driven tools to produce real-time information for improved decision making.This full-time opportunity offers competitive pay and eligibility for BCI's robust benefits offerings, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, disability benefits, 401(k), paid time off, and paid holidays. Specific responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop familiarity with business areas, including Sales and Marketing, Customer Service, Design and Engineering, Production, and Accounting.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to collect business requirements for analytical reporting.Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources and identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns within complex data sets.Assess current state reporting activities and develop solutions to automate and optimize.Develop and implement dashboards, reports, and KPIs to present data in meaningful ways to management and team members across all levels within the organization.Monitor the performance of reports and dashboards, complete data validation, and resolve data integrity issues.Identify data cleansing opportunities within source systems, and suggest ways to improve data accuracy, data collection systems, and other tools to optimize statistical efficiency and quality.Work with management to prioritize business reporting needs and establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions.Structure large data sets to identify useful material and employ graphs, infographics, and other methods to visualize data-present recommendations based on data analysis findings.Follow established safety rules, policies, and procedures at all times.Participate in a wide variety of other projects and tasks as assigned or requested.QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLSA Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or related field is required.Five (5) to seven (7) years of relevant experience is required. Prior manufacturing industry experience preferred.Must have previous experience with reporting packages and SQL databases and technical expertise regarding data models, database design, data mining, and segmentation techniques.Advanced Microsoft Office skills and familiarity with ERP systems and underlying data sources.Proven ability to present data findings in an easy-to-understand and straightforward manner.Excellent critical thinking skills to diagnose and solve problems along with strong business acumen.Strong analytical skills to collect, organize, and examine information with attention to detail and accuracy.Self-starter attitude that shows initiative and provides recommendations for improvements.Sense of urgency for completing initiatives on schedule and ability to work well in a fast-paced environment.Strong interpersonal skills, including excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work well independently and as part of a team.

At Curriculum Associates (CA), we believe a diverse team leads to diversity in thinking, making our products better for teachers and students. If you read this job description, feel energized by what you see here, and believe you could bring passion and commitment to the role, but you aren’t sure you meet every qualification, please apply! Above all, we are looking for the right person!Overview:Curriculum Associates is a rapidly growing educational technology and publishing company committed to making classrooms better places for teachers and students. We are a close-knit group and strive to maintain a supportive, collaborative, welcoming, and fun working environment. And the best part – we are an awesome group of data nerds!We are seeking talented individuals with strong analytical and written communication skills to join our growing Custom Analytics Team. In this role, you’ll participate in a broad range of projects related to Curriculum Associates’ suite of assessment and instruction products.The impact you’ll have:Use SQL to query and prepare analytical datasets from large relational databases with over 7 million records to inform districts’ and schools’ instructional strategiesConduct data analyses to identify the “story” behind student data in response to educator questions and concernsUse your creativity to contribute ideas for the design of data visualizations and educator-facing reportsWrite clear and understandable internal- and educator-facing responses to inquiries based on analytical findingsCreate and maintain technical documentation for analytic procedures in tools like Confluence and GitHubWho we’re looking for:An ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate the following:A graduate degree in mathematics, data analytics, education, social sciences, or a related field. Or, you have an undergraduate degree in such a field (or equivalent experience) and at least 1 year of experience in an analyst roleApplied experience coding in SQL and are comfortable writing complex SQL queries, joining multiple tables within a large relational databaseExcellent written and verbal communication skills, ideally with experience communicating complex technical topics to lay audiencesProven ability to manage multiple complex projects while maintaining a high level of attention to detailAbility to thrive in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities as needs shift or critical customer issues ariseWe’d also love to see, though not required:Experience working with SAS programming languageExperience in the field of education, especially the current national K-12 curriculum and assessment landscapeKnowledge of educational measurement principles, including familiarity with psychometric concepts such as measurement error, validity, and reliability estimationRequired for the application:Cover letterMore about this role:Location: Currently, all Curriculum Associates employees are working remotely due to Covid-19. Once it is safe to go back into the office, this position will be required to work out of our Billerica, MA office. Flexibility to work from home is possible on a schedule agreed upon with your manager.Relocation bonus: We will offer relocation support for a hire who will be required to move for this role.Starting Date: ASAPCompensation & Benefits: Competitive salary with great benefits including health, dental, and vision insurance, employer contributed 401K.

LIFEPlan CCO NY, LLC. empowers people with intellectual and developmental disabilities, and their families to lead happy, healthy and meaningful lives through choice, inclusion and participation. LIFEPlan supports the members we serve to dream, plan and achieve their goals, and to “Live the Life They Want to Live.” In turn, we offer a competitive compensation package, generous benefits and paid-time off, comprehensive on-going training, promotion opportunities and a work culture that values commitment, excellence, work life balance, teamwork, respect and dignity to support our staff to live their best lives.JOB SUMMARY:The Quality Data Analyst is responsible for LIFEPlan CCO’s Health Home Quality Metrics, and will work collaboratively with Quality, Program, and Care Management teams to support OPWDD and DOH regulatory requirements, benchmarks, and population health metrics.The Quality Data Analyst, under the direction of the Director of Quality Management, will understand the business needs of LIFEPlan CCO and how to use and manage the data to achieve those needs. The Quality Data Analyst will organize and manage large and varied data sets, analyze Health Home metrics, optimize reporting, and achieve organizational goals and high-quality outcomes. The Quality Data Analyst will gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends. The Quality Data Analyst will engage in problem solving and have knowledge of LIFEPlan CCO metrics and data sources.The Quality Data Analyst performs various functions, including collecting, storing, retrieving, and providing data that informs Quality, Program, Clinical, and Care Management business decisions.They are responsible for the development and preparation of data to provide useful information for internal and external stakeholders. The Quality Data Analyst will use data in creative ways and provide data visualization and detailed reports.The Quality Data Analyst understands OPWDD and DOH Policies, regulatory metrics, benchmarks, and measures, and will utilize their expertise in data management to create and monitor LIFEPlan quality metrics.The Quality Data Analyst will work across LIFEPlan departments to optimize Care Management operational efficiencies, advance quality measures, and interact with LIFEPlan staff as well as external sources such as OPWDD and DOH regulatory bodies.The Quality Data Analyst will work closely with the Director of Quality Management to optimize care management operations, the quality management plan, Health Home certification standards, and data monitoring efficiencies to advance quality measures.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Compile, organize, utilize, and report on all available data sets, including the Health Information System Electronics Health Record data, as well as external regulatory data interfaces including but not limited to CHOICES, RHIO, PSYCKES, TABS, and EmedNY.Work closely with Information Technology to implement databases for effective Quality data collection and storage, as well as performing data analytics and other strategies to optimize the efficiency and quality of the data being collected.Create and monitor various data metrics to support LIFEPlan CCO’s quality standards, redesignation protocols, overarching OPWDD and DOH regulatory requirements and measurement metrics. To include but not limited to the following:Population Health MetricsPreventative Care, Care for Chronic Conditions,Utilizations of Hospitals/ERs, Avoidable UtilizationSocial Determinants of HealthHEDIS MeasuresCCO/HH Policy Manual: Performance MetricsCCO/HH Policy Manual: Quality and Process Metrics for IDD PopulationCCDD: Care Coordination Data DictionaryLPDE: Life Plan Data ExchangeCMARTComprehensive AssessmentOther standard Health Measures and Metrics (PHQ9, CQL POMS, etc.)Monitor and promote data quality and performance levels aligned with LIFEPlan CCO’s Quality Management Plan, and LIFEPlan organizational goals and performance metrics. Including areas such as, but not limited to:Enrollment & RetentionCare Management Service QualityCare Manager PerformancePopulation Health MetricsNetwork Development and Access to Provider ServicesMember Experience Create and monitor Quality Management Plan Historical Data/Time Series ReportingAnalyze data to assist in delivering optimal care management strategies and assess clinical decision-making priorities. Provide data insights that drive clinical process improvement, such as reducing readmissions and hospital-acquired conditions.Monitor performance and quality management plan to identify any issues or ways to improve systems and database designs.Identify where operational system enhancements are required to improve quality, efficiency, better data, and overall organizational goals.Automate and integrate processes when needed to ensure optimal quality and efficiency.Evaluate system performance and design, as well as its effect on data quality.Gather data from primary or secondary data sources to identify and interpret trends. Investigate data to find and evaluate appropriate response to patterns and trends.Gather and interpret data from a variety of sources, including the electronic health record, the HIS, billing claims, finance reports, and member satisfaction surveys.Manage data and create reports to support LIFEPlan CCO target initiatives such a decreasing hospitalization/utilization, enhance the member experience, and ultimately drive Care Management quality improvement.Report data analysis findings to management to inform business decisions and prioritize information system needs.Share complex ideas verbally and visually in an understandable manner with non-technical stakeholders. Convert data into usable information that is easy to understand when needed.Provide care management quality, health home metrics reports and clinical data presentations to internal and external stakeholders as needed.Provide a high-level awareness of LIFEPlan CCO data quality and interpretation of data across multiple staff profiles and departments, from Care Manager to Administration.Report and present clinical insights from the analysis of data from health home claims data when and where available.Responsible for discovering discrepancies and patterns in available data.Responsible for standard and ad-hoc extracts/reports across multiple areas.Perform design and creation of Tableau visualizations for clinical consulting reports when available.Provide suggestions or direction on ways to improve health home care delivery, quality, and cost effectiveness for member health populations.Responsible for tracking on-going outcomes reports and manage priorities for upcoming reports.Build models that capture a wide range of health home and care coordination delivery data.Assist LIFEPlan’s Care Management Program and Administrative staff with the implementation of operational procedures to ensure compliance with OPWDD, DOH and Medicaid standards, quality assurance, and compliance based on all related regulatory funding sources.Provide reports as requested to LIFEPlan Administrative staff concerning care management performance and quality standards to ensure leadership is well informed and aware of operational issues and conditions. Bring matters of immediate concern to the Director of Quality.Works collaboratively with the LIFEPlan Care Management, Program and Quality leadership teams to gather and analyze data in order to make process improvements, achieve outcomes and make informed decisions based on data.All other duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS:A minimum of a bachelor's degree is required. Preferred majors include statistics, mathematics, computer science, health care administration, nursing/medical field, information management, or similar.A minimum of two (2) years of job-related experience; Data Analysis, Health Home, OPWDD IDD services, nursing, clinical experience, or other related experience is a plus.Qualifications in the areas of disability services, social work or counseling, or education, would be advantageous, as would a proven track record of developing strong relationships with a diverse range of people. Demonstrated ability to work in groups.Knowledge/Tools:Proficiency in programming languages, including Structured Query Language (SQL) and JavaScript, XML, or ETL frameworksKnowledge of statistical methods and tests.Experience with statistical packages, such as MS Excel, SAS, and SPSSExperience with Data reporting tools (Business Objects)Experience with data visualization tools.Knowledge of data management applications.Proficiency in managing electronic medical records.Exceptional analytical skills.Advanced problem-solving skills.Knowledge of best practices in data analysis.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Voted a Top Workplace for 2020 and for the past ten consecutive years, Fremont Bank has an immediate opening for a Project and Data Analyst in Livermore, CA.Position OverviewThe Project and Data Analyst will be responsible for the development and implementation of initiatives that leverage data in support of Bank, Borrow, and Invest. In this capacity, this senior analyst reports to the head of the Retail Bank and works closely with associates in the marketing department to access and analyze the relevant customer and bank data. This individual analyzes the bank’s client base and, based on this information and in light of the bank’s strategic priorities, creates an on-going plan to mine the client base in both the community bank and the residential lending divisions to capitalize on appropriate opportunities. This effort not only focuses on clients that have a product with the bank, but also on clients within the bank’s mortgage servicing portfolio. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to handle, or feel. The employee is also required to stand; walk; and reach with hands and arms. About Patelco Credit Union:We’re here to help people in communities throughout Northern California build financially healthy lives. What we earn, we return to our members in savings from lower loan rates, fewer fees, and personalized service that focuses on transparency, simplicity, and trust. Taking part in meetings and presentations to convey the findings is also a regular feature of this job.This role will require understanding how to collect data from various sources, potentially building a data warehousing solution, and then using initiative to interpret the raw data and identify any patterns in it, interpretations which might be included in a presentation or report.To begin analyzing data, data analysts must be able to render it visible. Compiling Excel spreadsheets, Power BI models and using DAX, M or SQL queries constitute another routine part of the work, as will coding and re-coding data contained within various databases to identify patterns.Being able to clearly understand and design data models is also a core function of the role. business needsMaintain data governance processes and controls by working with project and business leaders to analyze the impact of future changes on critical data and mitigate any potential risks to data qualityExperience analyzing financial data preferredTechnical Requirements:Bachelor's degree and five plus years related experience or ten years related experienceWeekend and evening work is possible due to projects and client issuesPower BI, SSRS, Crystal Reports (or equivalent reporting tool) experience is requiredAbility to program in M or DAX is strongly preferredUnderstand Power BI Online Services is strongly preferredStrong experience in ExcelExcellent skill in writing optimized SQL queriesDesign, architect, and build a data warehouse (in Azure is preferred)Experience in database systems is essential (MS SQL Server required; Azure SQL Server preferred)Ability to define time requirements based on complex tasks is essentialMicrosoft data certification (current) is a 2+ years in a data analytics-oriented role
Advanced SQL skills

1+ years of Looker development experience - LookML and dashboards
Curious minds who will always ask, "Why?"
Excellent attention to detail
Strong written/verbal communication skills

Nice to have

Interest in the Translation & Localization industry

You are

Results-focused. Exhibit commitment to goals and consistently delivers results
Problem Solver. Ability to define problems, assess and correctly identify root causes
A Team Player. Able to work collaboratively to design solutions based on minimal information
 within all levels of management
An Analytical Thinker. Ability to digest complex information and provide key insights
Customer-focused. Passionate for client success at all times
Detail-oriented. Supremely well organized with attention to detail
Creative. Demonstrate creative thinking

What matters to Smartling?

Two things - our customers and you. We believe that work is one of the most important parts of our lives, therefore we believe in a winning culture and great benefits:


Competitive salary and Employee Stock purchase plan
An opportunity to learn and advance your career
An energetic, value-driven, and fun culture and team spirit
Take a break when you need it – Flexible PTO
Medical, Vision, Dental, Life benefits for you and your family (including One Medical membership)

Sightline Payments LLC (www.SightlinePayments.com) is a leading gaming industry provider of innovative payment technology solutions.

The Data Analyst will participate in data organization, testing and maintenance of ETL functions, data reporting and participate in meetings and schema design to support application development. Duties include requirements gathering, testing, and assisting with promotion of new code. This position requires the candidate to act autonomously at times while adhering to and enforcing departmental and company policies and procedures. A successful candidate must efficiently and effectively schedule and perform assigned tasks or projects in a timely manner and maintain a high degree of accuracy and thoroughness in all work produced.

Candidates must be familiar with all aspects of SDLC, and comfortable working in an Agile/Scrum environment.

The position will work with product owners inside and outside of the business to assist in requirements gathering, development of functional specs, and to be a technical resource.

The candidate is expected to become familiar with the operations and process of internal business groups and become familiar with the technical challenges that come with boarding and certifying new customers.

The position will work directly with peers and API customers to assist in isolating existing and potential technical issues and act as the primary Business Data Analyst for product owners if data is not readily accessible to them.

Requirements

Computer science related bachelor’s degree OR equivalent experience.

- Experience writing complex SQL queries, views, stored procedures and functions

- Experience with schema design, indexing and data storage

- Experience/Knowledge of MVC, WCF, JSON, XML.

- Work with process owners to prioritize requests.

- Solid customer service skills and orientation.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

- Ability to exercise good judgement when making decisions.

- Ability to design and build according to best practice and remain focused on customer’s needs.

Build up in-depth knowledge of internal data stores and structures.

- Writes queries against SQL Server databases for ETL, reporting and data retrieval.

- Review and recommend changes to existing applications to improve efficiency.

- Design and maintain data systems and databases, including troubleshooting potential issues.

- ETL, organization and cleaning data in preparation for analysis.

- Preparing reports for key stakeholders.

- Be candid with all stakeholders, especially inside your team regarding the state of work in progress.

- Be flexible and receptive to design changes that may become necessary to deliver a high-quality product.

- Be a solid contributor on a Scrum team.

- Meets with IT and senior management on a regular basis to ensure status of pending deliverables are up to date.

- Provide ad-hoc reports or queries to senior management when requested.

- Works with QA, IT management and any stakeholders involved to clear blocking issues.

- Meets with project and program managers to understand how their processes and practices drive the design of new software projects.

- Acts as a technical resource to assist users and customers as appropriate.

Experience with defect tracking tools (TFS, JIRA, VersionOne).

- Experience supporting SSRS and Tableau.

- Change management experience.

About the Data Analyst positionWe are looking for a certified Data Analyst who will help us turning data into information, getting insights and developing business decisions based on the analysis results. Your responsibilities will include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design and also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

We expect you to possess analytical mindset with creative approach to tasks and the ability to find patterns and correlation when dealing with big volumes of information. You should also be able to work under a flexible schedule and report on your findings in a detailed and straightforward manner.Data Analyst responsibilities are:

Manage databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Collect required data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Retrieve information from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Collaborate with management to prioritize business and information needs
Find and evaluate new process improvement opportunities


Data Analyst requirements are:



2+ years' experience of working on a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst position
Significant experience of working with data analytical models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Excellent knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets, including Excel, SPSS, SAS and so on
Good practical experience with reporting packages (e.g. Business Objects), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Precise and effective written and verbal communication skills
BS degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Must be a U.S. Citizen

ABOUT FANDUEL GROUP

FanDuel Group is a world-class team of brands and products all built with one goal in mind — to give fans new and innovative ways to interact with their favorite games, sports, teams, and leagues. That's no easy task, which is why we're so dedicated to building a winning team. And make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give.

FanDuel Group is based in New York, with offices in California, New Jersey, Florida, Oregon and Scotland. Our brands include:


FanDuel— A game-changing real-money fantasy sports app
FanDuel Sportsbook— America's #1 sports betting app
TVG— The best-in-class horse racing TV/media network and betting platform
FanDuel Racing— A horse racing app built for the average sports fan
FanDuel Casino & Betfair Casino— Fan-favorite online casino apps
FOXBet — A world-class betting platform and affiliate of FanDuel Group
PokerStars US — The premier online poker product and affiliate of FanDuel Group

THE POSITION

Our roster has an opening with your name on it

We are looking for an Analyst to join our team. You will derive insights for FanDuel Group teams in order to drive actionable insights about the business. You will work alongside a group of other analysts through various individual and team assignments to continually evolve the various tools, models, and data visualizations used to drive the FanDuel Group business.

THE GAME PLAN

Everyone on our team has a part to play


Work with other analysts to produce insights and drivers of business performance
Create, modify and evolve models and data visualizations to better understand and explain the day to day performance of various KPIs
Create and maintain automated reporting processes visible to group-wide teams
Participate in presentations focused on using analysis to drive new business outcomes
Field and fulfill requests for various business inquires

THE STATS

What we're looking for in our next teammate


2+ years' experience in an analytics role preferred
Bachelor's Degree in a highly numerate major (Math, Stats, Econ, etc.) or relevant experience in data and/or business analysis
Strong personal organizational and time management skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a lot of ambiguity
Expert in SQL and Excel required; experience with Python or R desirable
Strong problem-solving skills, allied with track record of transforming data into actionable business insight
Experience working in groups and leading smaller intra year projects
Horse Racing interest is a plus

THE CONTRACT

We treat our team right

Competitive compensation is just the beginning. As part of our team, you can expect:


An exciting and fun environment committed to driving real growth
Opportunities to build really cool products that fans love
Mentorship and professional development resources to help you refine your game
Flexible vacation allowance to let you refuel
Hall of Fame benefit programs and platforms

Who We Are

BryterCX is the leading company in providing a Journey Intelligence SaaS solution to organizations in order to improve their customers experiences by removing friction and optimizing functions and channels. We make the world better by making business experiences better. The BryterCX Journey Management Suite - IRIS - provides organizations with the ability to increase revenue by lowering customer churn, decreasing costs by reducing analog channels, and improving the overall experience by matching the right capability to the customer.

Who You Are

You are a critical and analytical thinker who enjoys dissecting large, complex datasets. You have pride in your ability to craft creative solutions and communicate them clearly. You enjoy opportunities to learn and consider yourself a self-starter. You dont shy away from ambiguity but really shine when given a tangible business goal and a relevant dataset.

The Role

Our Data Analysts reside in BryterCXs Professional Services organization and fuel our analytics delivery to new and existing clients commonly spanning the financial, utility, insurance and telecommunication verticals. Our Data Analysts primarily perform analysis using BryterCXs product suite, BI tools, SQL, and open-source programming languages deriving customer experience-relevant findings for organizations and developing appropriate material to communicate those findings. Your time will be split between deriving analytical insights, developing BI solutions, communicating analytical findings, and collaborating with client user bases.

Overview of Responsibilities

Deliver Analytics: Craft and execute tactical approaches to client-requested analytics using BryterCX product suite, relational data exports, BI tools, and open-source programming languagesCraft BI Solutions: Design and construct dashboard solutions allowing clients to self-service analytics and insightsBuild Client Rapport: Build client capabilities and credibility through user training, focused mentoring, and ad hoc supportContribute to platform design: Leverage business knowledge and client-specific use cases to provide requirements and feedback in BryterCX design and use of client dataSupport product usage: Collaborate with BryterCX technical teams to ensure optimal software performance and enhanced functionality

Requirements

Bachelors Degree in computer science, information systems, business analytics, engineering, operations research, or related data-oriented field1-2 years of experience in software consulting or related data-oriented fieldPrior experience translating business requirements, decomposing and improving processes, or scoping analysesExcellent communication, presentation, writing and interpersonal skillsExceptional analytical critical thinking skills, including the ability to quickly assimilate new informationExperience in using analytics on a large dataset to solve business problemsProficient with the use of Microsoft ExcelProficient with SQL and relational data models and modelingComfortable with Python/R/open-source programmingExperience building original software solutions in Tableau, PowerBI, or comparable BI tool, a plusExperience in customer experience analysis, including web analytics, customer segmentation analysis, contact center analysis, marketing analytics, etc. a plusLive classroom training/coaching, a plusFamiliar with machine learning practices, a plus

Modern Health-Modern Health is a mental health benefits platform for employers. We are the first solution to cover the full spectrum of mental well-being needs through both evidence-based digital content and professional support from a global network of certified coaches or therapists all in one comprehensive app. Whether someone wants to proactively manage stress or treat depression, Modern Health guides people to the right care at the right time. We empower companies to help all of their employees be the best version of themselves, and believe in meeting people wherever they are in their mental health journey.

We are a female-founded company, backed by investors like Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, John Doerr, Y Combinator, and Battery Ventures. We partner with 220+ global companies like Lyft, SoFi, Pixar, Gusto, Okta, and Udemy that are taking a proactive approach to mental health care for their employees. Modern Health has raised more than $170 million in less than two years with a valuation of $1.17 billion, making Modern Health the fastest entirely female-founded company in the U.S. to reach unicorn status. We are looking for driven, creative, and passionate individuals to join in our mission.

In 2020 we tripled our employee headcount, doubled our customer base and grew our revenue 10x. As a hyper-growth company, we have maintained our people-first culture winning awards including Fortune's Best Workplaces in the Bay Area 2021 and maintaining an employee retention rate of 99.97% and an overall Glassdoor rating of 4.9 out of 5.

An inclusive and diverse culture are key components of mental well-being in the workplace, and that starts with how we build our own team. If you're excited about this role, we'd love to hear from you!The Role-Modern Health's Analytics and Data Science team is looking for a Data Analyst, who will report to the Senior Director of Analytics and Data Science. We're looking for someone who can bring technical expertise, beautiful dashboards, and keen cross-functional business instincts to the internal stakeholder of your choice. In this role, you will choose between Finance, Operations, Sales, Marketing, or Client Success and then partner closely with that team as the domain expert within Analytics.

You will identify which metrics matter and how to measure them, align those definitions across the company, implement them in our database, and report out via Looker. You will work on executive reporting and meet with VP level leaders regularly as well as dive deeply into the weeds to unblock any stakeholder in need of data and automate operational reports. In addition to instrumenting the business, you will keep an eye out for opportunities and own strategic analyses end-to-end, including developing the hypothesis, performing the analysis, and recommending action.

We would love to hear from you if you're smart, technical, and motivated and are excited to own relationships with key stakeholders, deeply understand their chosen area of focus, and turn confusing, granular data into simple charts and profitable insights.

We're committed to the health and safety of the community, so our team is currently working remotely and will continue to do so for the near term. Permanently remote opportunities are specifically indicated.What You'll Do-

Define, socialize, and measure KPIs aligned to company strategic objectives
Build data sources and dashboards that empower stakeholders to dig into the data that matters most to them and make informed decisions
Guarantee the reliability of your work by checking, double checking, then code review
Conduct deep-dive data analyses using your skills in SQL, Python, R, or the tool of your choice, then translate the results into actionable business recommendations
Partner with Data Engineering and other stakeholders to improve our data platform
Work with data scientists on the team when you discover game changing opportunities for larger modeling and machine learning projects

Who You Are-

2+ years of experience in analytics, data engineering, or data science at a tech company
Prior experience in investment banking, management consulting, or a particular domain such as Finance, Operations, Sales, Marketing, or Client Success (it's likely you can partner with the function that matches your background)
Expert in SQL and data visualization tools, especially with Looker or an equivalent BI tool
Spreadsheets and slide decks are cake, of course.
Experience applying data and analytics concepts to business problems cross-functionally
Proven success partnering with and explaining data and analytics concepts to non-technical team members at any level of seniority
Humble, scrappy, highly motivated, and thrive in fast-paced environments

Benefits-

100% coverage for Medical / Dental / Vision
Stipend towards mental health benefits
401k plan
Flexible PTO
Passionate team dedicated to making a positive impact
Awesome office with snacks and catered lunch in the Financial District
Generous parental leave policy
Unlimited career growth opportunity

Modea is seeking a passionate Data Analyst to join our fast paced and growing team. Data Analysts at Modea work very closely with our cross-functional teams and the client to help make data driven decisions and design and build awesome, consumer-grade web, and mobile experiences.

What does an Analyst do at Modea?

We tackle interesting projects on cross-functional teams made up of software engineers, analysts (thats you!), designers, project managers, and strategists. These team members work very closely with each other and the client to help them make data driven decisions and design and build awesome, consumer-grade web, and mobile experiences. We comb through all available data and establish ourselves as the expert on a project team to help clients make informed decisions.

Were currently looking for a sharp analyst to 1) execute interesting client projects and 2) help us grow our data science practice at Modea. The right person for this role is well trained in data science and various analytical techniques, is naturally curious, and has a familiarity with web analytics and the language of the internet (funnels, conversions, clicks, etc.).

Here are a few specific things wed be looking for you to do:

Lead on web analytics strategy: We do a lot of work on consumer-facing websites and apps. Part of your role would be to work with the visual design and engineering teams to set the measurement strategy for a particular site or application and ensure that the right goals and metrics are being tracked. This usually means working in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.Provide decision support: Its not enough to just keep the lights on for our clients. Well always want you to be analyzing the data we collect and looking for insights and trends that can inform our work or help our clients make better decisions. This will mean carving time out of your schedule to sit, analyze, and be thoughtful about the data and how it can best be visualized and interpreted. We often have to be flexible with our tools to meet client needs, whether that's open-source reporting platforms (Data Studio, Shiny) and Enterprise BI tools (Power BI, Domo, Tableau). Curiosity and a willingness to learn will take you a long way!Unlock data science: Our clients look to us to help them wrangle and understand their data. More and more clients are asking us to help them with advanced marketing analytics solutions, beyond the traditional world of web analytics and into the world of big data and algorithmic approaches. We help our clients analyze their web traffic patterns for insight, identify distinct groups of consumers to optimize their user journey and help our developers build out the most seamless and most effective personalization solutions.

Here is a list of skills and qualities that are critical to this role:

Be a great listener and communicator (oral and written)Be naturally curious and love problem solvingHave experience with common statistical/analytical methodsBe familiar with R, SQL, or PythonBe pleasant to work with and a team playerBe familiar with and interested in web analytics tools like Google Analytics and Adobe AnalyticsHave a college degree or a similar degree of life experienceBe passionate about analytics and measurement

 Additionally, here is a list of skills and qualities wed like you to have:

Have experience in a business intelligence roleBe able to work with HTML and JavaScriptCompleted some or all of the Google Analytics Academy courses

Who is Modea?

We are a technology consultancy with a mission to infuse greater control, transparency, and choice into the consumer healthcare experience. To do this, we work with large healthcare providers to help them build out a digital roadmap, then design and build mobile, web, and other digital experiences. We fundamentally believe that this work helps consumers have better information and access to care, and our clients to build stronger customer relationships.

Here are a few ways to get to know our work:

Check out the Vanderbilt Find a Doctor tool. Our analytics team helped guide the process for what to do. Read our Analytics guide and see some of our approaches to digital analytics and the Google suite.Find a location at Manatee Healthcare using this mobile app. We designed and built the feature set and user experience, and managed the measurement on the application.Search for a doctor at the Carilion Clinic website. We helped them transform their site experience and digital tools like search and find-a-doc.

Our business and team have consistently grown over the last four years and COVID-19 has dramatically increased the demand for our services. Currently, our office is working remotely and plans to continue until later in 2021, but ultimately, this position would be located at our headquarters in Blacksburg, VA, or in our new location in Nashville, TN.

Here are a few other reasons why you should apply:

First, youll love the work we do and the people youll get to do it with. Weve assembled an exceptionally smart and hardworking team and youll enjoy the work associations and general camaraderie with other Modeans. We also work with great clients who value us and our contributions.

Second, Modea offers a great benefits package that provides both a fun and enjoyable workplace and great perks that will improve your quality of life:

Paid time offTeam lunchesRegular employee events (parties, community service, etc.)Generous health, dental, and vision insurance401k with fully vested company matchingLong term & short term disability

Some of these benefits, like parties and team lunches, have had to adapt to the remote work environment we are currently in, but our operations team has found innovative ways to support our team, from regular care packages to a work-from-home stipend. We take care of our team.

The working environment here at Modea is one of accountability and autonomy. We are working to solve big problems. So we expect a lot, but give team members the tools, freedom, and flexibility to come up with great solutions. Together, our team is developing world-class technology that will change the way healthcare is delivered.

If youve read to this point you should probably apply. Not ready? Shoot us a note at careers@modea.com with any questions.

You must be eligible to work in the United States for this position.

Modea is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Modea is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Joining Capco means joining an organisation that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you're supported to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognize that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It's important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can. We believe that everyone brings something different to the table – so we'd love to know what makes you different.

ABOUT US

Capco is a global technology and business consultancy, focused on the financial services sector. We are passionate about helping our clients succeed in an ever-changing industry.

We are:


Experts in banking and payments, capital markets and wealth and asset management
Deep knowledge in financial services offering, including e.g. Finance, Risk and Compliance, Financial Crime, Core Banking etc.
Committed to growing our business and hiring the best talent to help us get there
Focus on maintaining our nimble, agile and entrepreneurial culture

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

As part of our on-going global expansion strategy, Capco is growing its UK Data Practice in our London office. We are currently seeking to recruit a number of management consultants with data analytics expertise to lead and develop teams to support large scale transformation projects for our leading Financial Services clients.

The applicant should:


Have a real passion for data and a commitment to shift the industry towards forward thinking data analytics
Be keen to join the team to develop the UK Data Practice capabilities and the broader Global Data Practice to support industry changing topics such as Predictive Analytics, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Use business judgment & analytical tools in driving the best results for the business unit. Achieved through a combination of using data, analysis, brainstorming sessions and business judgment in identifying & leading new opportunities and establishing oneself as the Subject matter authority in own field of expertise.
Enhance the existing advance analytics modelling, methodologies and contributing to new idea in methodology and modelling, machine learning algorithms and report visualization
Be supremely personally motivated to work in a team where clients become colleagues

SKILLS AND EXPERTISE

Ability to parse, manipulate and review large quantities of complex data
Ability to interpret data and translate complex material into easily understandable conclusions
Financial services industry background in data analytics
Experience of diagnostic and predictive techniques in areas such as modelling, CLTV, risk scoring, financial crime analytics, risk & compliance analytics and customer/marketing analytics e.g. segmentation
Experience using Rapid BI tools such as Qlik & Tableau and data analytics tools such as R or SAS
Programme Execution and Change management – proven ability to shape, design and lead the execution of data changes
Desirable experience as a Management Consultant

Professional experience is important. But it's paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

WHY JOIN CAPCO?

You will work on engaging projects with some of the largest banks in the world, on projects that will transform the financial services industry.

We offer:


A work culture focused on innovation and building lasting value for our clients and employees
Ongoing learning opportunities to help you acquire new skills or deepen existing expertise
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

About Foundation Finance:

Foundation Finance Company (FFC) is one of the fastest-growing consumer finance companies in the U.S. We work with home improvement contractors nationwide to help them close more sales through the use of flexible financing plans. FFC's full-spectrum lending approach has driven billions in originations and helped many customers make needed improvements to their homes. We're making big investments in both infrastructure and employee talent to keep up with our growth, so the time is right to join our team! It's a fast-paced environment with room to advance. We offer a competitive salary, medical/dental/vision benefits, 401(k) with company match, a casual dress work environment and much, much, more.

To learn more, check us out on Facebook at "Foundation Finance Company Careers." If you think you have what it takes to help our team succeed then apply today!

Data Analyst Description & Duties:

We are looking for a strong analyst to help drive profitable growth by leveraging data and analytics. This is a hands-on role requiring technical skills to query and manipulate data to develop data-driven reports and recommendations. The analyst will have a wide range of exposure to loan originations and servicing areas in consumer lending. The analyst will on a regular basis present reports, findings and recommendations to senior management to improve business strategies and practices

Duties may include, but are not limited to:

Dive into data and quickly become an expert on internal and non-traditional data sets. Maintain data and file integrity. Improve existing data query scripts and develop new ones as needed.Create user-friendly reports and Tableau visualizations for staff and management. Enhance existing and build new Tableau dashboards as needed.Track, review, manage and audit software development projects, particularly from database access and usage perspectives.Work with staff, managers and executives on analytic projects and develop data-driven solutions and recommendations.

The Ideal Candidate:

Applicants must be reliable, dynamic, sociable and enthusiastic team players; while possessing a positive "can-do" attitude, excellent judgement and communication skills. Applicants must also have great attention to detail and ability to multi-task under the stress of deadlines with a strong desire to help the organization succeed.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics or related field.Hands-on familiarity with SQL data querying, coding experience and understanding of basic coding syntax.Advanced Excel skills to create/edit pivot tables, understand/create/manipulate database formulas, create/modify macros (VBA knowledge preferred), adjust formatting to create professional reports.Advanced data visualization skills, preferably with Tableau.Must have the ability to research, think through and solve technical and analytic problems.Strong communication skills, attention to detail, analytical curiosity is required.

Working Conditions:

Office environment with significant time spent sitting, typing and talking on the telephone.

Overview

TheGuarantors is a Fintech / PropTech company that helps people access the housing they want, by providing innovative financial and protection products to renters, starting with their apartment application. We believe in bringing these solutions to renters to remove the stress and uncertainty about being accepted simply because you are a student, a recent grad with lower income, or you are in the US on a work visa and lack a FICO credit score. The biggest landlords across the country trust us to help lower risk across their portfolio, and we take that seriously, with zero churn and top scores in customer satisfaction year after year.

We have achieved 150%+ year over year growth the last 3 years, successfully raised over $27M in venture funding, and are actively expanding our footprint nationwide and internationally. We are making investments in becoming a technology-driven company delivering products that add value into the real estate market. Our goal is to reduce the massive inefficiencies in the industry through innovations in product development, delivery, and customer experience.

We have been recognized by Forbes (America's Best Startup Employer 2020), CNBC (2018 Upstart 100), CRETEch (#1 Information & Intelligence in Finance), and listed on the 2019 Insurtech 100, and we're backed by VCs who have also invested in Away, LinkedIn, and Slack, amongst others.

Role

The Data Analyst provides strategic recommendations to business stakeholders based on data models / analysis. You will serve as a data expert within the company helping others in simplifying their workflows and providing data-informed solutions.

Leveraging existing processes is important but the key to long-term success will be helping develop new and improved ones.

You enjoy working with data and communicating your findings to the rest of the business. You are able to connect the dots and interact across the organization (we operate as a distributed team and communication with people around the globe is a daily occurrence). You thrive in a fast-paced environment where your recommendations impact people on a daily basis.

Responsibilities

Design and develop data visualization and dashboards to increase access to data within the organization.Perform data analysis, explain findings in words that non-technical stakeholders will understand.Present results in a variety of formats (e.g. charts, graphs, tables) for leadership and business stakeholders.Work closely with Data Engineers who will create data schema and ELT processesMake recommendations to improve existing and build out new processes.Help the Data Team in making strategic recommendations to increase overall business success. Maintain internal documentation of work productsDeliver timely and effective technical assistance and troubleshooting when issues arise

Requirements

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. 4+ year of experience working for a small to medium sized technology company as a data analyst or similar role. Experience working with and deriving insights / business recommendations from complex data environments.Experience with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, etc.Strong SQL skills working with complex queries and data warehousesExperience coding in Python, to transform existing data sets.Proficiency with using Excel formulas and macrosExperience with data science or machine learning a plus

Compensation

Competitive SalaryWork visa sponsorship if neededHealth benefits401(k)Flexible work from home schedule (mandatory through COVID-19)Office with an amazing Manhattan view and natural light throughoutMonthly catered lunches for all employees as a venue to connect and build bridgesGroup activities for teams, from lunches to sports outings and events (virtual events as well)

About TheGuarantors

TheGuarantors is a fintech company dedicated to creating winning opportunities for the real estate ecosystem. For over four years the company has been rethinking industry inefficiencies and market needs to build innovative insurance and financial products that drive growth and protect long-term prosperity. With a focus on data and industry expertise in real estate, risk, and finance, TheGuarantors optimizes the relationships between landlords, leasing staff, brokers, and tenants by taking risk out of the leasing process and making it more efficient at the same time.

Designed for multifamily assets, Guaranti is a program of products and solutions built to optimize protection throughout the renter lifecycle. Securiti is the first financial amenity for office leases - a smarter security deposit that costs a fraction of the price of a traditional security package of cash or a letter of credit, with the same coverage landlords have come to expect. TheGuarantors is recognized as an innovator and pioneer in the insurance and technology industry, praised for its specialty products and excellent customer service.

The Business Intelligence team has big plans for 2021 and beyond, and we need a great Data Analyst to help us accomplish our goals. We leverage our data to gain better insights into the technology buying market, drive more efficient conversations with technology buyers, help our sales team build programs for our clients that will produce the highest quality leads, and ultimately offer our data in new and innovative product offerings.

YOUR MISSION:

As a Data Analyst, your job is to find the truth in the data. Youll be responsible for ensuring data/reporting requests for the organization are met quickly and accurately. You will use your analytic skills to provide insight into the process of fulfilling Lead-Gen efforts. You will be the go-to for gathering data to help improve the efficiency of the Operations team.

Youll be the go-to for everything from the most basic Excel formatting request, elaborate and sometimes fancy Tableau reports, and complex SQL queries. Youll coordinate the data flow from our internal systems to our internal stakeholders.

YOUR DAY TO DAY AT TA:

Meet with the BI team each morning to catch up on priorities and review data requestsWork with the operations team to completely understand their processes. With that understanding, identify data-driven solutions to increase the efficiency of our Lead-Gen effortsBuild dashboards and reports that provide valuable insightsTroubleshoot and catch errors in SQL queries that dont produce expected results, ensuring the data or insights you provide not only meet the business need but make common sense Identify gaps in data collection needed to support analytical endeavorsCommunicate data nuances and insights with internal stakeholders in a clear and concise mannerUtilize data findings to educate key stakeholders on trends and strategic implications

QUALIFICATIONS:

3+ years professional experience or equivalentExperience with SQL is a mustMust be detail-oriented, organized, and have the ability to multitaskAbility to demonstrate supportive relationships with peers, clients, partners, and corporate executivesMust be flexible with a can-do attitude and have the ability to remain professional under high-pressure situationsHigh level of initiative, self-direction, and accountability for actionsExcellent time management and planning skills are essentialAbility to retain and protect confidential materialAbility to thrive in a reactive environmentBachelors degree or equivalent experience in Business Analytics preferredExperience with Tableau or similar data visualization toolsExperience with Python is a plus

PERKS AND BENEFITS:

Aside from an outstanding company culture that fosters innovative ideas, teamwork, professional growth, and friendly competition, we offer great benefits. You'll have the chance to work alongside fun, intelligent, and driven folks who believe in what we're doing at TA. Check out our list of benefits:

Comprehensive health insurance (medical, dental, vision, life and disability)401(k) Retirement Plan with matchFlexible Paid Time Off MacBook Pro or PC laptop, your choiceWeekly Career Development Meetings for your first 60 days, plus ongoing daily & weekly team huddles and an hour of 1:1 time with your manager every 2 weeksFitness reimbursementSubscription to the Headspace appBucket List BenefitTeam Outings and Volunteer OpportunitiesProfessional development opportunities and incentivesPaid Maternity and Parental LeaveCatered lunches 4 days a weekMilestone celebrations for birthdays, weddings, work achievements, and moreCoffee, snacks, ping pong, and beer on Fridays

ABOUT US:

TechnologyAdvices purpose is to create opportunities for technology buyers, technology vendors, our team members and our communities.

We are dedicated to educating, advising, and connecting buyers and sellers of business technology. As a trusted resource across hundreds of technology verticals, our unbiased research and crowd-sourced product reviews help buyers find the right software to grow their business.

We work with vendors to grow their customer base through our unique lead generation, content creation, and digital advertising programs. These programs improve product awareness by placing matched solutions in front of their ideal customers using multiple touchpoints.

TechnologyAdvice is based in Nashville, Tenn, and was recently named to the Inc. 5000 list of Americas Fastest-Growing Private Companies for four consecutive years. In 2019, TechnologyAdvice received a Nashville Business Journal Small Business Award and was named the Market Mover in the Nashville Chambers NEXT Awards, as well as being honored as a Tennessee Top Workplace in 2019 and 2020.

At TA, we believe our differences make us stronger. We foster a diverse and inclusive culture where people feel safe being themselves. Our DE&I committee hosts quarterly meetings and sessions to help us continually learn and grow. Our Core Values are: Be Transparent, Make Calculated Decisions, Crave Knowledge, Challenge Mediocrity, and Value Each Other.

Pre-employment screening required.

#LI-Remote

COVID-19 RESPONSE:

TechnologyAdvice is committed to the safety and wellness of each of our employees. In response to the COVID-19 Pandemic, the following measures have been implemented for employees working in-office based on CDC and local guidelines:

Social distancing between workspaces Mandatory mask policyFrequent sanitation of high-touch surfacesRoom capacities for all conference roomsCOVID-19 contact and exposure response policy Individually packaged catered lunches

A Hybrid Work Policy was also launched. We offer flexibility to work in the location where you feel most productive. Eligible team members can work in-office, remotely from home, or a blend of the two, assuming acceptable minimum requirements are met.

Data Analysts will be responsible for analyzing and problem solving as its relates to data, types of data, metadata, and relationships among data elements within a business system or IT system. This role interacts with end users and reporting analysts to understand key data entities and data structures in capturing detailed data requirements. They will identify correlations between raw enterprise data and management, so data extraction, analysis and transformations are used as actionable intelligence. Data analysts may receive requests from all members of the Bank including the management team and must have strong task prioritization skills in addition to good statistical and critical thinking skills. Data analysts will often assist in complex modeling to properly present data. Data analysts are responsible for consulting and assisting with project analysis, program design, report writing, scripting, dictionary synchronization, and other technical maters required for computer applications. Data analysts will create models and data sets that adhere to written standards and best practices, and fully test and document to assure expected results. The position requires strong data analysis, problem-solving, business process, time management, reporting skills and knowledge of R, SQL and/or Python.

ESSENTIONAL FUNCTIONS

Working under the supervision of the Data Management manager, partner with key business users and stakeholders to define data migration requirements, resolve data issues and validate procedures and results.Identify, document and validate data migration scope, data requirements and system/ infrastructure solutions.Define source system data requirements, data quality issues/fixes and business rules.Map and specify target data requirements and associated data transformations.Test data migration results and validate migration with key users and business analysts.Be a self-starter with solid interpersonal skills - projecting a very positive customer-service-oriented attitude.Adhere to processes and policies.Assist in the creation of dashboards for senior managementDevelop automation or efficiencies in production and monitoring reportsAssist in creating and maintaining department proceduresMonitor and analyze the Banks business lines and provide reporting to senior managementCreate insights from external datasets; market, industry, geographic and economicParticipate and enhance the current method of Bank reportingPreparation of models for senior managementAbility to become proficient in the Banks CRM tool, SalesforceAssist with document gathering for loan sales, participations and pledged assets.Participate in any current and future department goalsAssist supervisor on any ad hoc requests

QUALIFICATIONS

Experience with mapping source to target systems with large data modelsStrong SQL abilities for database query and reportingExpert in Excel and proficient in other MS Office toolsAbility to understand and work with large quantities of data to identify trends, errors and gapsAbility to multi-task and manage concurrent projects in various stages of developmentImpeccable customer service and interpersonal skills and excellent written and verbal communications skills mandatory.Experience in customer management, contracts, product, pricing, invoicing and commissions preferredExperience with ERP systems preferredExperience with agile project management techniques preferredExperience with data governance, master data management, data warehouse and business intelligence preferredNo less than 3 years experience as a data analyst or related role in supporting large data projectsStrong knowledge of Query based languagesStrong Database skills, SQL strongly preferred;Strong analysis and validation skills;Excellent interpersonal skills to work with end users to develop reports;3 + years of related experience.

ABOUT NORTHERN BANK

Northern Bank is a full service bank dedicated to providing practical, common sense financial solutions to help our customers’ lives and businesses grow. From deposit products to loans to payment and collections services, we work hands on with our entrepreneurial customers, both locally and across the country, to provide the financial support they need to realize their personal and business goals. Founded in 1960, Northern Bank has assets of $2 billion with 12 locations serving communities throughout Middlesex County. Northern Bank is a Member of the FDIC, an Equal Housing Lender, and consistently ranked among the best performing community banks in New England. For more information on online banking services, please visit www.NBTC.com or follow Northern Bank on Facebook (/NorthernBankMA/), Twitter (@northernbankma), Instagram (@northernbankma) and LinkedIn (company/northern-bank-ma/).

We’d love to hear from you if you like:

Start-up energy working with a brilliant and passionate team Exponential growth (5 straight quarters of 50-100%+ quarter over quarter growth) Flat structure and access to senior leadership for continuous mentorship Meritocracy - we promote based on performance, not tenure Rockstar teammates. You will be working with a strong team with prior work experience at Amazon, Microsoft, NVIDIA, Alibaba, etc.

About jerry.ai:

Jerry.ai is building the first financial platform for your car that helps people optimize the cost and experience of owning a car (making ownership easy & affordable). There are 240M cars in the US alone. For most people, cars are one of the most expensive assets they own and families on average spend 20% of their income on car expenses, making this a massive market.

We have started with helping people optimize the cost of car insurance and our vision is to help people in every aspect of car ownership. Since our product launch, we have been growing really fast for the past 18 months and our users love the product (rating 4.5 in the app store). Jerry.ai is founded by serial entrepreneurs who previously built and scaled YourMechanic (“Uber for car repair,” the nation’s largest on-demand car repair company). We have raised over $50M+ in financing

About the role:

We are looking for a Data Analyst who is passionate about making an impact by owning our core data pipeline that powers our top line metrics. You will be leveraging your data expertise to help evolve data models in various components of the data stack. You will also be working on architecting, building, and launching highly scalable and reliable data pipelines to support the company’s growing data processing and analytics needs. Your efforts will allow access to business and user behavior insights, leveraging the data to fuel other functions such as Analytics, Data Science, Operations and many others.

Responsibilities:

Owner of the core company data pipeline, responsible for scaling up data processing flow to meet the rapid data growth Consistently evolve data model & data schema based on business and engineering needs Implement systems tracking data quality and consistency SQL and MapReduce job tuning to improve data processing performance

Requirements:

B.S. degree in a related discipline. 1-3 years of data analysis experience. Proficient in SQL, especially with Postgres dialect. Expertise in Python for developing and maintaining data pipeline code. Experience with BI software (preferably Metabase or Tableau). Experience with Hadoop (or similar) Ecosystem. Comfortable working directly with data analytics to bridge business requirements with data engineering
